## Overview

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSArchiver], a concrete subclass of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSCoder], provides a way to encode objects into an architecture-independent format that can be stored in a file. When you archive a graph of objects, the class information and instance variables for each object are written to the archive. The companion class [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSUnarchiver] decodes the data in an archive and creates a graph of objects equivalent to the original set.

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSArchiver] stores the archive data in a mutable data object ([doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableData]). After encoding the objects, you can have the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSArchiver] object write this mutable data object immediately to a file, or you can retrieve the mutable data object for some other use.

In macOS 10.2 and later, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSArchiver] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSUnarchiver] have been replaced by [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSKeyedArchiver] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSKeyedUnarchiver] respectively—see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/Archiving/Archiving.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/10000047i].

# NSArchiver

**Class**

A coder that stores an object’s data to an archive.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSArchiver
```

## Overview

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSArchiver], a concrete subclass of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSCoder], provides a way to encode objects into an architecture-independent format that can be stored in a file. When you archive a graph of objects, the class information and instance variables for each object are written to the archive. The companion class [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSUnarchiver] decodes the data in an archive and creates a graph of objects equivalent to the original set.

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSArchiver] stores the archive data in a mutable data object ([doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMutableData]). After encoding the objects, you can have the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSArchiver] object write this mutable data object immediately to a file, or you can retrieve the mutable data object for some other use.

In macOS 10.2 and later, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSArchiver] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSUnarchiver] have been replaced by [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSKeyedArchiver] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSKeyedUnarchiver] respectively—see [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/Archiving/Archiving.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/10000047i].

## Initializing an NSArchiver

- **init(forWritingWith:)**: Returns an archiver, initialized to encode stream and version information into a given mutable data object.

## Archiving data

- **archivedData(withRootObject:)**: Returns a data object containing the encoded form of the object graph whose root object is given.
- **archiveRootObject(_:toFile:)**: Creates a temporary instance of `NSArchiver` and archives an object graph by encoding it into a data object and writing the resulting data object to a specified file.
- **encodeRootObject(_:)**: Archives a given object along with all the objects to which it is connected.
- **encodeConditionalObject(_:)**: Conditionally archives a given object.

## Getting the archived data

- **archiverData**: The receiver’s archive data.

## Substituting classes or objects

- **classNameEncoded(forTrueClassName:)**: Returns the name of the class used to archive instances of the class with a given true name.
- **encodeClassName(_:intoClassName:)**: Encodes a substitute name for the class with a given true name.
- **replace(_:with:)**: Causes the receiver to treat subsequent requests to encode a given object as though they were requests to encode another given object.

## Constants

- **Archiving Exception Names**: Raised by `NSArchiver` if there are problems initializing or encoding.

## Deprecated

- **NSUnarchiver**: A decoder that restores data from an archive.

## Inherits From

- NSCoder

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
